title: Improving ECG diagnosis of left ventricular hypertrophy with contrastive ECG-echocardiogram learning
details: MD Diaw, S Papelier, A Durand-Salmon, J Oster
abstract: Left ventricular hypertrophy (LVH) refers to a left-sided thickening of the heart muscle and is commonly diagnosed with echocardiography (Echo). Because existing ECG criteria for LVH (ECG-LVH) have poor sensitivity at high specificity, we investigated …
